replies.body: YES, CLOUD 9 IS BACK BABY, FEEL THE WRATH OF NA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
To say Cloud 9 is back, don't we need Hai to actually score a win on another champion not named Zed?
He keeps getting zed because their opponents seem to be more worried about Balls on Rumble, LemonNation on Veigar, and Sneaky on Kallista.
I don't think they'll be as worried about Veigar after the rework.

In week 3 he had a KDA of 14 including a 3/0/7 Kassadin game, and a 1/0/3 Leblanc game.  Neither was a hard carry where he was racking up kills, but he stayed safe and they won. 

That was actually his highest KDA for a week this split, and those were the first 2 wins in their current stretch which includes winning 7 of 8, and the 5- 0 record on Zed.
ABOUT FRIGGIN TIME
Idk I think Best Bleebtown NA is a rising star. Just check out their AD carry chaluim. Things are lookin up for this team!
Honestly the only reason Chaluim does well is because Sunjiah Supports him with some mad {{champion:53}}

They really just were on a downtear because they had lost their jungler/top laner Haywouldjablome but after picking up mzfatigue, they have been slowly climbing back to their original form. Silver here we come!
DOWN TURN YOU LIMEY WOLLOX
nah man, its all mzfatigue, he's more OP than {{champion:72}}

i heard he bought his account
Yeah apparently he said that in an aram. Calling in Riot Lyte to {{summoner:11}} this hackernoob
i know! mzfatigue is really the flame that {{summoner:14}}  d their comeback
hey sunjiah nice summoner name

How is CLG going 2-2 knock them off the power ranking but TSM going 2-2 in the same two weeks move them up a rank? Expecially when CLG lost to C9 and liquid. Where as TSM lost to Impulse, which is far stranger. 

I swear the bullshit towards CLG and for TSM in these rankings is disgusting. It's almost as bad as them saying that CLG hadn't won against TSM in a long time the split after CLG went 4-0 in the regular season against tsm.

This. People, please get your game up. This^ is the exact reason why you keep getting negative (and sometimes angry) feedback for the rankings you make.

CLG played two teams that know how to make use of an advantage and KNOW how to close out a game, and there is no shame in losing to such teams, nor should it be judged as harshly. 

TSM, meanwhile, managed to make two mistakes (one a throw) at Baron in one game and still lost to a team that had no freaking idea how to close a game out, judging by their actions. And this kind of bad play earns TSM spots in the rankings. 

I call bulls***.

TL knows how to close out games? This is the same team vs TSM that had all the towers and inhibs down plus 5 dragons (3x) and 2 barons and still could only win with a backdooor TP once TSM left their base to contest the 3rd baron.........Yeah Liquid knows how to close out games alright. They might be the first team in pro league history to lose 3 team fights in a row while having baron and 5 dragons lol
YOE are 13-1 on the regional ranking but 9-1 on the international one... wha?
Lol what. He isn't talking about skill compared to other regions. YOE's win/loss record is 13-1 in the Taiwan section and 9-1 in the international section, even though they should be the same.
Ahh this is what happens when u dont get enough sleep for doing projects lool, i apologize for being blind

So...Cloud 9 gets up right behind TSM and Liquid is 20th but CLG isnt on here? Ok.
CLG going 2-2 losing against C9 and Liquid drops them off, but TSM losing to Impulse moves them up a slot. Usual bias in these rankings.
They need two separate Team Liquids on the rankings - Team Liquid with Piglet and Team Liquid with Keith.
I usually agree for the most part with these. This week's is a little off for me... CJ fell over rather easily to SKT and they gained two spots? Hmph.

C9 is back to Power Rankings assuming Hai can play other champions besides Zed. Interesting!
They are 7-1 I in their last 8 games, and Hai has a win on Kassadin and Leblanc in that stretch.  Zed is clearly his best champ, but it's not like they can't win with other champs in mid.

Although Hai showed he can play other champs and c9 can win i don't feel as though he had performances in those games that were anything special and more of the sway of those matches fell on Meteos, Sneaky and Balls
This is more than 2 weeks old....
So SK is above Fnatic in the European rankings, yet below them internationally? Not sure if I understand how that works...

Domestic play version International play. It isn't very complicated. Look at how well SK does in the EU LCS. Then See how well they did at IEM Katowice.

Case and point, some teams through scrimming and repetition just know people in their region and their regions meta, but when they hit the international stage, all of that knowledge and experience with their region, rarely helps.
TSM..LOL,C9..LOL..JUST STOP..Worse than EP
Please stop putting European teams above TSM when they are clearly better. Please get your bullshit EU LCS bias out of your rankings please.
